name: Incandescent
description: Incandescent is a fast paced action arcade game that scales the difficulty to your skill level. The goal is simple, pilot your ship and defend yourself against waves of unique enemies and bosses. Different powerups will drop to help you with upgrades to your weapons and health.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP Processor: Dual Core 2.0GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 128MB video RAM and at least Shader Model 3.0 DirectX: Version 10

reviews.review_text: I like the aesthetic/appearance/sounds/music but the game really needs some polishing to be worth playing.  Controls lack tightness and precision - esp movement (360 controller)  If you take hits, the ONLY feedback is a declining health bar and controller vibration - no other clues!?  Enemies spawn in pretty much anywhere/anytime without any warning!!  Enemy bullets travel so fast as to be mostly unavoidable  On some levels you can simply stop playing and you'll survive for long periods as some enemies simply stick to preset patterns and don't hit you (after a while they will kamikaze but I reckon you could make a quick coffee!!)  It's the polish which makes the difference between a shooter and a GREAT shooter - that feeling you CAN avoid the enemies if only you're lithe (rather than lucky)  This doesn't have that
Fun game.  If you are in to twin stick shooters. Pick it up. Its a steal at .49. casual gamers might not get it.
Come on what the heck is this?! xd
